result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges and supervision fees from 25% of prison wages, remainder to be paid during period of ES. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Successfully complete any counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Defendant to complete a Batterers treatment program.
- Defendant to complete parenting classes.
- Defendant to have No Contact with the victim. The court will leave it up to the DOC to modify while defendant is incarcerated. Once defendant is released any modification of the No Contact Order will be left up to the defendant's agent.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin statutes.

- No contact with firearms. Defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms. Court advises defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Consecutive to: -Feb. 22, 2016 Honorable Jeffrey Kremers.  Order signed, sentence on count two is commuted to six months in HOC. Consecutive to count one, but concurrent with the current sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl Dean Lawhorn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (14 pages) commencing JANUARY 25, 2016 received and filed.
Based on Order signed on 2/22/2016, count one is only sentence bifurcated, showing on JOC by itself.
Count two, per Order signed on 2/22/2016

Received, signed and filed:
Order Commuting Sentence.
The sentence on count 2 is commuted to six months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1 but concurrent with present sentence.
Copies forwarded to the parties on today's date.
File forwarded to the Clerk of Court for correction.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify sentence imposed on count two.

Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in custody. Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Statements as to sentencing by state and defense.  
As to count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 3 1/2 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 385 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 years and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to complete a batterers treatment program.
     *  Defendant to complete parenting classes.
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge and his 
        supervision fees from 25% of his prison wages, remainder to be paid during his period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  Defendant to have no contact with the victim.  The court will leave it up to the DOC to modify while defendant is incarcerated.  Once defendant is released any modification of the no contact order will be left up to             the defendant's agent.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin 
        statutes.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.
As to count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 18 months in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for -0- days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 6 months, consecutive to count 1 but concurrent with his current sentence,  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to complete a batterers treatment program.
     *  Defendant to complete parenting classes.
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV surcharge and his 
        supervision fees from 25% of his prison wages, remainder to be paid during his period of extended supervision.
  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  Defendant to have no contact with the victim.  The court will leave it up to the DOC to modify while defendant is incarcerated.  Once defendant is released any modification of the no contact order will be left up to             the defendant's agent.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, credit form.

Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 On state's motion, Court ordered count 1 amended to:
Physical Abuse of a Child Recklessly Causing Harm, Wisconsin Statute 948.03(3)(b).
.
As to counts 1 as amended and count 2:
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to count 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Defense requesting that the defendant be able to have contact with his family.
The court reminded the deputy in court to make sure that the only no contact order listed at the jail is with Shamona C.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conference held between counsel.  State's motion to adjourn the currently scheduled jury trial date heard and granted.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.    Jury trial date vacated.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Earl D Lawhorn not in court, in custody.  Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant was not produced for today's date.
The state has filed 2 motions, one asking to admit the 911 calls and the other to admit "other acts" evidence.
The court found that the 911 call was admissible and the court will allow statements 1, 2, 3 and 4.  The court not allow statement 5.
Case calendared for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case was calendared for a jury trial today. State is requesting an adjournment.   No objection by the defense.
The court was given a 911 tape to review prior to making any rulings on the state's motion that was filed.
Defense was given a new offer today.
Case adjourned for a status date and another jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
This assignment is only effective as of 8-3-2015.     mld

Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in court with attorney John Matthew Krejci.  Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer James Hunter.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court took judicial notice of the certified records attached to the criminal complaint regarding the domestic violence assessment on case 2012CM2264.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  All available discovery and offer letter turned over to defense counsel, per the State.  Case is adjourned for FInal Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-25-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shamona C and ALL of her children.

Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Earl Dean Lawhorn in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
